usefulItems: spring form tin (Ø 23 cm), baking paper, skewer, oven
title: Chocolate Beetroot Cake

ingredients.content: 100 g sunflower oil, plus extra for greasing
250 g beetroot, raw, peeled, cut in pieces (see tip)
250 g dark chocolate, small pieces or callets
50 g dark chocolate, roughly chopped, for garnish

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 160°C. Grease and line sides and base of a cake tin (Ø 23 cm) with baking paper.
Place beetroot in mixing bowl and grate <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides and lid of mixing bowl with spatula then grate again <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and grate <b>8 sec/speed 8<b> then melt <b>3 min/50°C/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then melt again <b>1 min/50°C/speed 4<b>.
Add sugar, flour, almonds, oil, bicarbonate of soda, baking powder and vanilla extract then mix <b>20 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add eggs and reserved grated beetroot then mix <b>20 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to prepared tin. Bake for 55-60 minutes (160°C) until a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. Leave to cool in tin. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl.
Once cake is cool, remove from tin. Place vanilla sugar in mixing bowl and grind <b>30 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cream cheese then mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Spread icing over top of cake and serve garnished with roughly chopped chocolate.

hintsAndTricks: Use rubber gloves when peeling beetroot to protect hands from staining.
